notes: #description

On 18 September 2020, in Cartagena, Valparaiso region, a group of nearly 10 rioters attacked an ambulance and a military truck with rocks and other objects. The health workers were attending an emergency call when the group, started the attack. The military car was attending the call of the workers attacked. No injuries were reported. [size=nearly 10]

On 17 September 2020, near Ercilla, Araucania region, a group of demonstrators used a car as a barricade across the Route 5. The group burned down the vehicle, interrupting the traffic for several hours. Near the area, a banner demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals was found. A second source reported armed confrontations, but this version has yet to be confirmed. [size=no report]

On 17 September 2020, in Puente Alto, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 50 rioters attacked a group of civilians that were allegedly robbing a woman. The victims had to be interned in the hospital due to their injuries. [size=nearly 50]

Around 17 September 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, residents of the Agtima neighborhood protested over an increase of insecurity in the area. The protested followed a robbery that resulted in one person killed. The group demanded more police presence. [size=no report]

On 17 September 2020, in Santo Domingo, Valparaiso region, residents protested against the mobility restrictions imposed due to the coronavirus outbreak. The group claimed that the regulation affected their everyday lives, including work. Protesters demand more flexible regulations for residents. [size=no report]

On 16 September 2020, in Lo Espejo, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 30 people gathered in the wake of a funeral. Riots broke out as police forces attempted to enforce the no large-gathering law created over the coronavirus pandemic. Police used water cannons to disperse the group. 5 people were arrested. [size=nearly 30]

On 16 September 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, nearly 200 Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated against police brutality and excessive use of force against members of the community. The group clashed against police forces when state forces attempted to disperse the group. 21 people were arrested and 5 police officers were reported injured. [size=nearly 200]

On 16 September 2020, in route 150 near Penco, Biobio region, a group of demonstrators set on fire a barricade across the road. A bus driver was reported injured when another car ran over him while attempting to remove the blockage. The motive for the demonstration was not mentioned by the source. [size=no report]

On 15 September 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, members of the LGBT community protested against the lack of enactment of laws to improve inclusion and promotion of rights for member of LGBT groups. The group demanded the dismissal of the Minister of Equality, claiming a lack of action to perform her tasks. [size=no report]

source: El Sur; La Estrella Concepcion; Biobio Chile
notes: On 15 September 2020, near Tirua, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen attacked a group of workers of a local logging company. The armed men opened fire against the group when these were arriving at their workplace on buses in Route P-95. Subsequently, perpetrators set a vehicle on fire before running away. Two workers were reported injured.

Around 15 September 2020 (month of), in Osorno, Los Lagos region, citizens protested over delays in the construction of a social housing project. Protesters claimed that there is a lack of information in the advances of the designs. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, a group of women protested against the increasing violence in the south of the country. The group gathered to deliver a letter to show their support to the victims of arson attacks and raise awareness about the conflict in the southern regions of the country. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, members of the Mapuche community occupied a plot of land, claiming it belonged to the indigenous community. The building was burned down by unidentified perpetrators the day before the occupation. Police arrived and evicted the group. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Canete, Biobio region, a group of nearly 500 citizens protested to demand justice in a case of a person killed by suspected indigenous militiamen. The group marched through the streets demanding advances in the police investigation. [size=nearly 500]

On 14 September 2020, in Ercilla, Araucania region, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen attacked a group of police officers near the police station. The group opened fire and subsequently ran away in a pick-up truck. Two police officers were reported injured by pieces of glass.

On 14 September 2020, near Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of demonstrators clashed against police forces. The group built barricades to block the route T-340 in Pellines. The motive for the demonstration was no reported by the source. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in La Reina, Metropolitana, a group of residents protested against the selling of a public plot of land. The group claimed that the area should be used for the construction of social housing. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, in Santo Domingo, Valparaiso region, nearly 50 residents protested against the mobility restrictions imposed due to the coronavirus outbreak. The group claimed that the regulation affected their everyday lives, including work. Protesters blocked the bridge that connects the commune with San Antonio. Police dispersed the group. [size=nearly 50]

On 13 September 2020, in the route that connects Collipulli with Angol, Araucania region, a private house and a barn was set on fire by unidentified perpetrators. The victim claimed that she had received threats on the previous days by members of the Mapuche indigenous community and the same plot was occupied and by some Mapuche indigenous people.

On 13 September 2020, in Canete, Biobio region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of a person killed by suspected indigenous militiamen. The group gathered near the house of the victim and carried candles to demand advances in the police investigation. [size=no report]

On 13 September 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, riots broke out when police attempted to carry out a police control to check a report of domestic violence in an illegal settlement in Rahue Bajo neighbourhood. A group of residents attacked the officers resulting in three officers injured and seven people arrested. [size=at least 7]

On 12 September 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, members of the Mapuche community occupied a plot of land, claiming it belonged to the indigenous community. Hours later, the police arrived and used tear gas to evict the group. [size=no report]

On 12 September 2020, in Quintero, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens attacked a presumed sexual offender. Police forces intervened and used tear gas to disperse rioters when the group blocked the medical team that was attending the victim. [size=no report]

On 12 September 2020, on Collipulli, Araucania region, one teenager was reported injured in a drive-by shooting by unidentified armed men in a car, in an attack against a group of Mapuche indigenous people who were occupying a private plot of land. The victim was hospitalized due to the severity of the injuries.

On 12 September 2020, near Pailahueque, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen attacked a train operator and set on fire at least two wagons. Perpetrators built a barricade across the railway forcing the machine to stop. Subsequently, they opened fire against workers when these attempted to extinguish the blazes from the railcars. No injuries were reported.

On 12 September 2020, in Pedro Aguirre Cerda, Metropolitana, riots broke out during a funeral as police forces attempted to enforce the no large-gathering law created over the coronavirus pandemic. Police intervened when neighbors reported some shots fired in the air and fireworks. Police arrested 10 people. [size=at least 10]

Around 12 September 2020, in Las Condes, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 300 citizens protested against the implementation of a new constitution in the country. With the constitutional referendum expected to be held on 25 October 2020, a group of citizens gathered near the main square and chanted slogans against the approval. Police arrested three people. [size=nearly 300]

On 11 September 2020, in Ercilla, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen opened fired against two private houses of a recognized industrial farmer. The victim claimed he and his family had to hide under the beds to avoid the impacts. No injuries were reported.

On 11 September 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. Demonstrators built barricades in different areas of the city. No arrests or further damages were reported. [size=no report]

source: 24 Horas (Chile); El Mercurio (Chile); AFP; Biobio Chile
notes: On 11 September 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, dozens of people demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. Police forces of Chile clashed with demonstrators using tear gas and water cannons when the second blocked nearby streets and started throwing objects to the officers. Additional sources claimed the event also included a group of people that support changes in the constitution. Three officers were reported injured and 14 people were arrested. Another source claimed 17 people were arrested and at least 10 officers were injured. [size=at least 14]

On 11 September 2020, in Recoleta, Metropolitana, nearly 800 citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. Police forces of Chile clashed with demonstrators using tear gas and water cannons when the second blocked nearby streets and started throwing objects at the officers. 11 people were arrested and one officer injured. [size=nearly 800]

On 11 September 2020, in San Felipe, Valparaiso region, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. Demonstrators set on fire private vehicles and barricades. Clashes between police forces and demonstrators were reported, as police forces used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group. [size=no report]

On 11 September 2020, in the Antofagasta region, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. There were reports of violence and clashes between police forces and demonstrators, but no particular episode was mentioned. [size=no report]

On 11 September 2020, in Estacion Central, Metropolitana, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. Demonstrators built and set on fire barricades across the streets. There were reports of clashes between police forces and demonstrators. Police used tear gas to disperse the group. One person was reported injured by the impact of a tear gas canister. [size=no report]

On 11 September 2020, in La Cisterna, Metropolitana, a group of citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. Demonstrators used Molotov bombs against police forces. [size=no report]

On 11 September 2020, in Huechuraba, Metropolitana, a group of citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. Demonstrators used Molotov bombs against police forces. [size=no report]

On 11 September 2020, in the Tarapaca region, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. There were reports of violence and clashed between police forces and demonstrators, but no particular episode was mentioned. [size=no report]

On 11 September 2020, in Estacion Central, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 150 citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. Demonstrators attacked the police station using Molotov bombs and other objects. One police officer was reported injured by the impact of pellets. [size=nearly 150]

On 11 September 2020, in Rancagua, O'Higgins region, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. There were reports of violence and clashes between police forces and demonstrators, but no particular episode was mentioned. [size=no report]

Around 11 September 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of nearly 150 Mapuche indigenous people protested against the construction of a damn in an indigenous reserve area. The group marched through the city and subsequently, they delivered a formal letter to the government agency for the environment claiming the project would cause several damages to the eco-system. [size=nearly 150]

On 11 September 2020, in the rural area of Los Sauces, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire eleven vehicles and multiple pieces of equipment that belonged to a logging company. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Pamphlets connecting the attack to the CAM were found in the area.

On 11 September 2020, in Valparaiso, Valparaiso region, citizens demonstrated on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. There were reports of violence and several barricades built by demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 11 September 2020, in Vina del Mar, Valparaiso region, citizens protested on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. The group gathered near the main square. [size=no report]

On 11 September 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, citizens protested on the date that marked the 47th anniversary of the military coup that overthrew a democratically elected government. The group gathered near the main square. [size=no report]

Around 10 September 2020 (as reported), in the rural area of Angol, Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated when police forces searched a Mapuche community area. Demonstrators threw rocks and other objects against the officers. Five police officers were reported injured and two people were arrested. [size=no report]

On 10 September 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of citizens and Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated against the construction of a dam in an indigenous reserve area. The group marched through the city and later a smaller group of demonstrators vandalized the offices of the government Indigenous agency (Conadi) located in the city center. Police arrested 7 people. [size=at least 7]

Around 10 September 2020 (as reported), in Vina del Mar, Valparaiso region, a group of nearly 20 people demonstrated against the construction of a social housing project in the city. The group set on fire one of the backhoes used in the construction. [size=nearly 20]

On 9 September 2020, in Cayucupil, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire at least three trucks and a crane. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found in the area.

On 9 September 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, a group of Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated against a meeting between the government representatives and a group of religious leaders from their community. The demonstrators claimed that the religious leaders are not representatives of the Mapuche indigenous people. Police forces used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group. A second source reported barricades near the place were the meeting took place. [size=no report]

On 9 September 2020, in Iquique, Tarapaca region, port workers and police forces clashed following a fight due to a disagreement between the union members. Workers began fighting between them, after which police intervened. Rioters attacked the union's headquarters with rocks and other objects. [size=no report]

On 9 September 2020, in Calbuco, Los Lagos region, a group of citizens protested against delays in the construction of a social housing project. The group claimed that the area is already occupied by other families. The group blocked a nearby road for several hours. [size=no report]

On 9 September 2020, in Paillahue, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire two private houses. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were injured in the event. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found in the area.

On 9 September 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen attacked a group of workers and owners of an industrial farming business. The perpetrators opened fire against one car and tied up 5 people who were in the area at the moment of the attack. Subsequently, the armed men set a barn and other equipment on fire. No injuries were reported.

On 8 September 2020, in Lloncao, Biobio region, suspected Mapuche indigenous militiamen set on fire three private houses. Perpetrators threatened with guns the house owners and subsequently spread gasoline in the buildings. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were injured in the event. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found in the area.

On 8 September 2020, in Paicavi Grande, Biobio region, a group of suspected Mapuche indigenous militiamen opened fire against a group of civilians who were hanging out near an area where minutes before militiamen carried out an arson attack. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found in the area. Witnesses claimed the armed men stopped the vehicles were they were escaping and shot dead one person.

Around 8 September 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, hundreds of stranded Venezuelan citizens protested to demand support from their embassy to return to their country, since they have been unable to returns since the beginning of the coronavirus pandemic. The group marched to deliver a letter to the ambassador in charge. The mayor of the commune of Providencia participated in the event. [size=hundreds]

On 6 September 2020, in Coquimbo, Coquimbo region, a group of nearly 50 demonstrators broke into the local market and destroyed furniture and products that belonged to local salesmen. The group clashed with police forces when the second evicted the demonstrators from the building. 24 people were arrested and a police officer was registered injured. The motives of the demonstration are not clear, but authorities suspected it is in connection with a legal process to demolish the building. [size=nearly 50]

On 6 September 2020, in Calfuco, Los Rios region, citizens and Mapuche people demonstrated to demand improvements in the road that connects the hamlet with the city of Valdivia. The group claimed the road had collapsed several times, affecting the mobilization of the town's residents. Additionally, the group claimed delays in the payments for the expropriation of territories used to built such road. The group blocked the traffic with a barricade for several hours. [size=no report]

On 6 September 2020, in Peleco, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a private house. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were injured in the event. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found in the area.

On 6 September 2020, in the rural area of Contulmo, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a barn and a private house. The structures were located near the boundary between the communes of Contulmo and Canete. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

On 5 September 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 50 nurses and health technicians protested to demand formal recognition of their degrees in the National Health Code. The group claimed this change would improve their work conditions. Police forces used water cannons to disperse protesters. [size=nearly 50]

On 5 September 2020, in Coquimbo, Coquimbo region, a group of nurses and health technicians protested to demand formal recognition of their degrees in the National Health Code. The group claimed this change would improve their work conditions. Protesters gathered near the local hospital to raise awareness about their demands. [size=no report]

On 5 September 2020, in Las Condes, Metropolitana, a group of more than 50 citizens protested against the implementation of a new constitution in the country. On the eve of a referendum to change the current constitution, a group of citizens gathered near the main square and chanted slogans against-the approval. Police arrested three people. [size=more than 50]

On 5 September 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of nurses and health technicians protested to demand formal recognition of their degrees in the National Health Code. The group claimed this change would improve their work conditions. Protesters marched to the city's main square. [size=no report]

On 4 September 2020, in Rancagua, O'Higgins region, a group of nurses and health technicians protested to demand formal recognition of their degrees in the National Health Code. The group claimed this change would improve their work conditions. Protesters gathered to raise awareness about their demands. [size=no report]

On 4 September 2020, in Ovalle, Coquimbo region, a group of nurses and health technicians protested to demand formal recognition of their degrees in the National Health Code. The group claimed this change would improve their work conditions. Protesters gathered to raise awareness about their demands. [size=no report]

On 4 September 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana, more than 100 citizens staged a pot-banging demonstration over general discontent with the government. The group blocked the traffic and demanded improvements in healthcare, education system, pensions, among other things. Police Forces of Chile used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the demonstrators. While some sources claimed the event was nonviolent, another reported clashes between demonstrators and police officers, and stated that nearly 400 people participated in the demonstration. [size=more than 100-nearly 400]

Around 3 September 2020, in Coronel, Biobio region, a group of nearly 30 citizens, including the mayor, protested against the construction of an oil terminal in the commune. The group raised concerns about the environmental impact of the project. The protest was organized during the visit of a government official to the town. [size=nearly 30]

Around 2 September 2020, in Vina del Mar, Valparaiso region, teachers and parents from a local school protested against the shutdown of the institution. The group reported mismanagement of resources by school administrators and demanded an audit. [size=no report]

On 2 September 2020, in San Ernesto, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire at least five vehicles and pieces of equipment that belonged to a logging company. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

Around 2 September 2020, in Los Angeles, Biobio region, restaurant owners protested over the lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group marched to the city hall to demand government measures to mitigate the economic crisis that affect private businesses. [size=no report]

On 2 September 2020, in Valparaiso, Valparaiso region, a group of nearly 100 women joined a burial ceremony to protest against a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. The group organized a motorcade with motorcycles and wore purple bandannas to raise awareness against gender violence in the country. [size=nearly 100]

On 2 September 2020, in Quidico, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire two private houses. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were injured in the event.

On 1 September 2020, in the rural area of Tirua, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen ambushed a police unit. The police vehicle was forced to stop due to a barricade on the road, subsequently, perpetrators opened fire against the officers. No injures were reported.

On 1 September 2020, on Route 5, near Curico, Maule region, a group of truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The protest followed a series of arson attacks carried out by suspected indigenous militiamen in the south of the country. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. One protester was killed when a truck driver, who did not take part in the protest, intentionally drove through the group following an argument with the protesters. [size=no report]

actor1: FNPL: Fatherland and Liberty Nationalist Front
notes: Around 1 September 2020, in La Serena, Coquimbo region, suspected Fatherland and Liberty Nationalist Front members destroyed the memorial of an Ecuadorian citizen killed by military forces during the political unrest of October 2019. Pamphlets threatening the family and demanding to stop the legal process against the military forces were found. The documents were signed by the far-right paramilitary organization Fatherland and Liberty Nationalist Front.

actor1: Police Forces of Chile (2018-) Prison Guards
notes: On 31 August 2020, in Lebu, Biobio region, members of the Mapuche indigenous people reported that a group of Mapuche prisoners was beaten up by the prison guards during relocation to another prison. Lawyers of the victims claimed they were not previously informed of the transfer and endorsed the version of the attack.

On 31 August 2020, in Lebu, Biobio region, Mapuche indigenous people protested against the transfer of Mapuche arrested individuals to a different prison. Police forces used water cannons to disperse the group, mostly formed by the families of the prisoners. [size=no report]

On 31 August 2020, near Curico, Maule region, a group of truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Protesters gathered together and parked their vehicles alongside the road near the city. [size=no report]

On 31 August 2020, in Linares, Maule region, truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Protesters gathered together and parked their vehicles alongside the road near the city boundary. [size=no report]

On 31 August 2020, in San Javier, Maule region, a group of truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Protesters gathered together and parked their vehicles alongside the road near the city. [size=no report]

On 31 August 2020, in the rural area of Mulchen, Biobio region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire eleven vehicles and multiple pieces of equipment that belonged to a logging company, in Pichibureo area. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Pamphlets connecting the attack to the CAM were found in the area.

On 31 August 2020, in Punta Arenas, Magallanes region, health workers protested in front of the regional hospital to demand justice for a female colleague sexually assault by two patients of a coronavirus treatment center. The group claimed there is a lack of personal and security guards in the health center. [size=no report]

On 31 August 2020, on the road that connects Talca and San Clemente, Maule region, truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Protesters gathered together and parked their vehicles alongside the road. [size=no report]

On 31 August 2020, in Talca, Maule region, a group of 100 truck drivers joined the protest over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Protesters gathered together and parked their vehicles alongside the road near the city boundary. [size=100]

On 30 August 2020, in Pillanlelbun, Araucania region, truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The protest followed a series of arson attacks carried out by suspected indigenous militiamen in the south of the country. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. The drivers intermittently blocked the traffic for several hours. [size=no report]

Around 30 August 2020, on Route 5, near Huara, Tarapaca region, a group of truck drivers demonstrated over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Two civilians were reported injured when their vehicle crashed against a truck used to block the freeway. [size=no report]

Around 30 August 2020, in Puerto Montt, Los Lagos region, truck drivers demonstrated over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. Civilians reported that a group of demonstrators suddenly blocked the road almost causing a car accidents. When the car evaded the group, demonstrators chased the vehicle until they reached a police control. [size=no report]

On 30 August 2020, near Los Angeles, Biobio region, a group of nearly 800 truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The protest followed a series of arson attacks carried out by suspected indigenous militiamen in the south of the country. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Protesters gathered together and parked their vehicles alongside the Route 5. [size=nearly 800]

Around 30 August 2020, in Trapen, Los Lagos region, truck drivers demonstrated over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. Civilians reported that a group of nearly 10 demonstrators harassed them when they attempted to cross a road blockage. Victims claimed the truckers chased the victims almost causing a car accident. [size=at least 10]

On 29 August 2020, in Pillanlelbun, Araucania region, a group of truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The protest followed a series of arson attacks carried out by suspected indigenous militiamen in the south of the country. On 29 August 2020, near Lo Vasquez, Valparaiso region, a group of truck drivers protested over a spike in attacks on transport trucks. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Protesters gathered together and parked their vehicles alongside the Highway 5. [size=no report]

On 29 August 2020, in Lo Espejo, Metropolitana, a group of people attempted to lynch a police officer when his car accidentally ran over a child during a police chase in the commune. Official sources claimed the officer was forced to flee the scene without providing first aid to the kid. [size=no report]

On 28 August 2020, in Temuco, Araucania, a group of nearly 200 citizens demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Demonstrators attempted to march through the streets before police forces used water cannons to disperse the group. Seven people were arrested and two police officers were reported injured. Another group organized a second demonstration near the local prison. [size=nearly 200]

The protest followed a series of arson attacks carried out by suspected indigenous militiamen in the south of the country. The group demanded more police presence on the roads and the approval of a law that increases penalties to people involved in attacks against truck drivers. Protesters blocked the entrance to the San Vicente port for several hours. [size=no report]

On 10 August 2020, on the route P60R that connects Canete and Alamos, Biobio region, a group of indigenous Mapuche people demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. On 9 August 2020, in Huentelolen, Biobio region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a pick-up truck that belonged to a logging company. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 9 August 2020, in the rural area of Lautaro, Araucania, suspected indigenous militiamen burned down the house of a local farmer. Authorities suspect the event is related to an arson attack since the house was empty and without energy service when the event was reported.

On 9 August 2020, in Curacautin, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities. Demonstrators and police officers clashed when the first ones began throwing rocks at the officer, barricades were built across the roads to enter the commune. Several private houses and businesses were destroyed. One police officer was reported injured. [size=no report]

Around 9 August 2020 (weekend of), in Valdivia, Los Lagos region, a group of citizens protested over the protection of a natural area in the commune. The group demanded that the government declare the wetland a natural reserve. [size=no report]

On 9 August 2020, in Tirua, Biobio region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a private house in the north of the commune. According to the victim, the perpetrators force the lock and then proceed to used gasoline to burned down the house. No fatalities were reported. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights and the release of arrested Mapuche individuals.

On 8 August 2020, on the route that connects Contulmo and Canete, Biobio region, a delivery truck was set on fire by a group of suspected indigenous militiamen. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 8 August 2020, in Malvilla, Valparaiso region, nearly 100 truck drivers protested over the poor working condition of drivers. The group demanded improvements in the contracts and job stability. Additionally, the union demanded more security for those drivers who work in the south of the country following an increase of arson attacks. They organized a motorcade to the city of San Antonio. [size=nearly 100]

On 8 August 2020, near Mulchen, Biobio region, a group of indigenous Mapuche people demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Demonstrators used rocks to built barricades and block the traffic. [size=no report]

On 8 August 2020, near Pitrufquen, Biobio region, a group of indigenous Mapuche people demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Demonstrators used rocks to built barricades and block the traffic in Route 5. The group displayed banners with slogans supporting the demands of Mapuche indigenous communities. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, near Trosco, Los Lagos region, Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities. Demonstrators used large wooden logs to block the road u-400 and U-220. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, in Purranque, Los Lagos region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire heavy machinery and other vehicles that belonged to a forest plantation company. Pamphlets connecting the attack to the CAM were found in the area.

On 7 August 2020, in Lumaco, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people demonstrated to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities. A group of demonstrators destroyed a statue in honor of a military general and threw the bust into the local river. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, in Capitan Pastene, Araucania, suspected indigenous militiamen attempted to burn down the house of a recognized businessman and owner of a logging company. The victim declared that he and his family had received multiple threats previous to the attack. No fatalities were reported.

On 7 August 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of nearly 50 citizens protested delays in the construction of a social housing project. The group staged a small gathering and demanded to expedite the construction process. [size=nearly 50]

On 7 August 2020, in Nueva Imperial, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people protested against the construction of high voltage towers in their territory. The group claimed the project did not include prior consultation with the communities or residents. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, Santiago, Metropolitana, a mob attacked a person accused of stealing objects from private cars. The victim was severely beaten and tighten to a nearby bus station by a group of rioters. Police forces intervened to protect the victim. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, in Limache, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens demonstrated to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. The group attempted to beat up the mother of the victim, who is considered an accomplice in the crime. Demonstrators broke into the private house and set on fire the belongings of the woman. Police intervened to protect the woman. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, near Los Angeles, Biobio region, truck drivers protested over lack of security to work in the highways and rural roads of the southern region of the country. The group blocked Route 5 between Los Angeles and Mulchen to demand more police control, insisting that arsons attacks increased over the last months. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, a group of Mapuche indigenous people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Protesters gathered in the main square of the city and blocked the traffic for several minutes. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, near Lumaco, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. The group blocked the route R90 for several hours. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, in Vina del Mar, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens demonstrated to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. The group gathered near the police station in which the suspect was arrested. Police forces arrested an undetermined number of protesters for breaking the quarantine measures due to coronavirus outbreak. [size=no report]

On 7 August 2020, in Villa Alemana, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Citizens marched through the commune. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Lumaco, Araucania region, a group of more than 100 Mapuche people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and the return of ancestral land to the communities. The group took a building from a government agency and blocked nearby streets for a couple of hours. [size=more than 100]

On 6 August 2020, in Huechuraba, Metropolitana, a group of 30 people demonstrated to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. The group attack a police station in the commune. [size=30]

On 6 August 2020, in Tirua, Araucania region, police forces evicted a group of nearly 100 Mapuche indigenous people who occupied the city hall building the night before. The group demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. 3 people were arrested. [size=nearly 100]

On 6 August 2020, in Quidico, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire two private houses. Indigenous Mapuche called for more drastic measures after police forces evicted a group of protesters from the town hall in Tirua earlier that day. No fatalities were reported.

On 6 August 2020, in the rural area of Tirua, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a truck. Indigenous Mapuche called for more drastic measures after police forces evicted a group of protesters from the town hall in Tirua earlier that day, who demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. No fatalities were reported.

On 6 August 2020, near Tirua, Araucania region, Mapuche indigenous people blocked the road P-70 with barricades to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and land rights for indigenous communities of the country. The blockage followed a call for more drastic measures after police forces evicted a group of demonstrators, who demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Recoleta, Metropolitana, a group of nearly 30 citizens demonstrated to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. The group burned down a bus of public service and used homemade weapons against the officers, while police used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group. A second report claimed nearly 100 people took part in the demonstration. [size=nearly 30]

On 6 August 2020, in Villa Alemana, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Protesters gathered near the house were the perpetrator reportedly lives. Additionally, other groups staged pot-banging protests from their windows. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Angol, Araucania region, a group of Mapuche people protested near the local jail to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Police forces dispersed the group and destroyed structures built by protesters to protect them from the cold weather. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitana, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Residents of the commune staged a pot-banging protest. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Antofagasta, Antofagasta region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Residents of the commune staged a pot-banging protest. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Residents of the commune staged a pot-banging protest. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Nunoa, Metropolitana, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Residents of the commune staged a pot-banging protest. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Limache, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens, mostly women, demonstrated to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. The group attempted to beat up the perpetrator, breaking the front windshield of the police car transporting the prisoner. A large group continued demonstrating in front of the police station for several hours. [size=a large group]

On 6 August 2020, in Quilpue, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Citizens organized a pot-banging protest in the commune. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Vina del Mar, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Citizens organized a pot-banging protest in the commune. [size=no report]

On 6 August 2020, in Valparaiso, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens protested to demand justice in a case of sexual and gender violence against a 16-year-old teenager. Residents of the commune staged a pot-banging protest. [size=no report]

On 5 August 2020, in Tirua, Biobio region, a group of nearly 100 Mapuche people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. The group took over the offices of the town hall to protest. [size=nearly 100]

On 5 August 2020, in Plon Maquehue, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire machinery and other equipment from a company dedicated to the extraction of aggregates. Perpetrator burned down 18 trucks, two backhoe, and the local offices. Pamphlets connecting the attack to the WAM were found in the area.

On 5 August 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of nearly 50 Mapuche people protested to demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. A group of 20 Mapuche occupied the offices of a government agency for 6 hours, while outside the building a second group of nearly 30 people displayed banners with slogans supporting the demands of Mapuche indigenous communities. [size=nearly 50]

On 5 August 2020, in the rural area of Traiguen, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a backhoe that belonged to a Mapuche religious leader. The victim has been accused by some members of the community of carrying negotiations between government officials without the approval of the indigenous community.

Around 5 August 2020 (week of), in Quisco, Valparaiso region, a mob attacked a person that reportedly broke into a private store to stole goods. The victim was severely beaten by the store owners and other residents, before being arrested by police forces. [size=no report]

Around 5 August 2020 (week of), in the Los Rios region, workers of the regional Ministry of Public Health stopped activities and staged a demonstration to protest over alleged political favors inside the institution. Workers claimed bribes are used to keep individual stores open despite the coronavirus pandemic. The group demanded reforms and more transparency from the department managers regarding the management of coronavirus restrictions. [size=no report]

source: El Austral Temuco; El Austral Osorno; La Nacion (Chile)
notes: On 4 August 2020, in Lumaco, Araucania region, police forces and Mapuche indigenous people clashed in a demonstration. Demonstrators demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and land rights for indigenous communities of the country. Police used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group, while a second report accounts that demonstrators attacked the police station. Ten people were reported injured, among them 5 police officers. [size=at least 5]

source: El Austral Temuco; El Austral Osorno; Biobio Chile
notes: On 4 August 2020, in Temuco, Araucania region, nearly 300 demonstrators demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals and land rights for indigenous communities of the country. The group blocked the streets for several hours. Police used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group. 11 people were arrested. [size=nearly 300]

Around 4 August 2020, in Cartagena, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens demonstrated in support of the Mapuche communities. The group gathered together following reports of clashes between residents and Mapuche activists in other areas of the country, the group also demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Police forces clashed against demonstrators when the second one attack police vehicle with rocks and built barricades to block the traffic. Four people were arrested. [size=at least 4]

Around 4 August 2020, in the rural area of Padre Las Casas, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen set on fire a truck. Perpetrators threatened the driver with guns, before setting the vehicle on fire. According to the driver, militiamen opened fire against the victim. No fatalities/injured were reported.

On 3 August 2020, in Canete, Biobio region, a group of citizens demonstrated in support of the Mapuche communities. The group gathered together following reports of clashes between residents and Mapuche activists in other areas of the country. The group also demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Police forces clashed against demonstrators. Some private businesses reported damages. [size=no report]

Around 3 August 2020, in Providencia, Metropolitana region, a group of dozens of Haitian citizens protested near the consulate over the lack of support to return to their country. The group, mostly economic migrants, lost their jobs in the country due to the coronavirus pandemic and demanded a humanitarian flight. [size=dozens]

On 3 August 2020, in Talca, Maule region, a motorcade of taxis drivers protested over lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. The group drove through the city. Protesters blocked the streets for several minutes. Police arrested 3 people. [size=at least 3]

On 3 August 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, police forces of Chile dispersed a protest organized by Mapuche indigenous people. Demonstrators demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. No arrests were reported. [size=no report]

On 3 August 2020, on Route 5 near Ercilla, Araucania region, a group of indigenous Mapuche demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Demonstrators set on fire barricades across the highway. [size=no report]

On 3 August 2020, in Collipulli, Araucania region, a group of citizens demonstrated in support of the Mapuche communities. The group gathered together following reports of clashes between residents and Mapuche activists in other areas of the country. Demonstrators set on fire a truck and vandalized the offices of the local public prosecutors. The group also demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. Police Forces used tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group. Five people were arrested. [size=at least 5]

On 3 August 2020, in Lonquimay, Araucania region, a group of nearly 100 citizens protested in support of the Mapuche communities. The group gathered together following reports of clashes between residents and Mapuche activists in other areas of the country. The group performed a traditional Mapuche ceremony in the city center and subsequently blocked the traffic for several minutes. There were reports of police and military units in the area, but no intervention was reported. [size=nearly 100]

On 3 August 2020, in Osorno, Los Lagos region, police forces of Chile dispersed a protest organized by Mapuche indigenous people. Protesters demanded the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. There were no reports of violence by protesters, six people were arrested. [size=at least 6]

On 3 August 2020, in the rural area of Ercilla, Araucania region, suspected indigenous militiamen and Police Forces of Chile clashed near the Collico area. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. One police officer was injured.

On 3 August 2020, in the Araucania region, military forces of Chile reported the deployment of military troops to protect the traffic along Route 5. The actions followed a series of arson attacks carried by suspected indigenous militiamen.

On 2 August 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, firefighters reported that suspected indigenous militiamen opened fire against the group when these were attending an emergency called for a fire of a summer cottage in the area. No fatalities were reported.

On 1 August 2020, in Curacautin, Araucania region, a group of nearly 400 rioters clashed with Mapuche indigenous people who took the city hall to demonstrate and demand the release of arrested Mapuche individuals. On 1 August 2020, in the rural area of Collipulli, Araucania region, a group of suspected indigenous militiamen cut down at least 52 threes from a three plant. The owner claimed the attack represents a substantial economic loss for his company. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 31 July 2020, in Concepcion, Biobio region, nearly 100 drivers of public buses and taxis from Concepcion, Lota, Coronel, and other communes, protested over lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. notes: On 31 July 2020, in Lota, Biobio region, drivers of public buses and taxis demonstrated over lack of financial support during the coronavirus pandemic. On 31 July 2020, in Maipu, Metropolitana, a group of residents demonstrated over the increasing insecurity in the area. The group blocked the traffic with barricades to demand more police in the neighborhood and the regulation of illegal settlements. [size=no report]

The group claimed that police forces often confiscated their merchandise and demand for a formal system to assign them spaces to work. [size=nearly 50]

On 2 June 2020, near Tolten (Araucania), nearly 100 fishermen demonstrated against the government. The group considers the economic measures taken by the government to mitigate the economic crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic are insufficient and demanded more protection for independent anglers. Demonstrators also demanded the resignation of several public workers. The group was dispersed by police forces when barricades were built and set on fire. [size=nearly 100]

On 2 June 2020, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), fishermen demonstrated against a court ruling that jeopardizes their work. The group demanded new regulations by building barricades in the city center. [size=no report]

On 1 June 2020, in Valparaiso (Valparaiso), maintenance workers of green areas in the city protested over the termination of the contract of at least 65 of their employees. The group protested in front of the municipality to demand job security. [size=no report]

Around 1 June 2020, in Providencia (Metropolitana), nearly 130 of Colombian citizens protested over the lack of support to return to their country. The group got stranded after several countries shut down their borders due to the coronavirus pandemic. Protesters demanded a humanitarian flight. [size=nearly 130]

On 1 June 2020, in San Antonio (Valparaiso), citizens beat up and attempted to lynch two robbers. The victims had previously stolen from a couple of pedestrians. One of them had to be hospitalized due to the severity of her injuries. [size=no report]

On 31 May 2020, in Covadonga (Los Rios), suspected indigenous militiamen attacked the property of a logging company. The men set on fire two heavy machinery and pamphlets connecting the attack to the CAM were found in the area. There have been several attacks in Los Lagos region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 30 May 2020, in Chuquicamata (Antofagasta), two unidentified perpetrators set on fire the private vehicle of the union leader of a local mining company. The men were recorded by private security cameras when they used Molotov bombs and other flammables to incinerate the car.

On 30 May 2020, in Puerto Montt, Los Lagos region, a member of the Police Forces of Chile opened fire against a driver of an online ride-hailing company. The driver tried to avoid the officer when police attempted to make traffic control without wearing a proper uniform or identification patch. One person was reported injured.

On 30 May 2020, in the rural area of Puren (Araucania), a group of six militiamen set on fire heavy machinery and a truck that belonged to a logging company. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 29 May 2020, in Estacion Central (Metropolitana), a group of nearly 40 demonstrators built and set on fire barricades across the streets. The reasons behind the demonstration were not reported, but several reports of demonstrations over the lack of food and low income due to the coronavirus lockdown measures were registered over the week. Police forces attempted to dispersed the group with tear gas and water cannons. [size=nearly 40]

On 28 May 2020, in Puente Alto (Metropolitana), more than 150 rioters clashed against the Police Forces of Chile when the first ones attempted to loot a local factory. Police used tear gas and water cannons to disperse rioters. The event happened during a week of demonstrations over the lack of food and low income due to the coronavirus lockdown measures in the country. 1 person was arrested. [size=more than 150]

On 28 May 2020, in San Pedro de la Paz (Biobio), nearly 100 citizens protested over the lack of food and low income due to the coronavirus lockdown measures. The group demanded food assistance. [size=nearly 100]

On 28 May 2020, in Melipilla (Metropolitana), a group of nearly 60 rioters clashed against the Police Forces of Chile when the first ones attempted to loot a local supermarket. The event happened during a week of demonstrations over the lack of food and low income due to the coronavirus lockdown measures in the country. Police reported one officer injured and an undetermined number of people arrested. [size=nearly 60]

On 28 May 2020, in Concepcion (Biobio), a group of citizens, including the mayor and town councilors of the district of Chiguayante, protested over delays in the delivery of food support in their district. The group claimed that the number of food supplies announced by the national government is consistent with the number of provisions received. Police arrested one of the protesters when the group attempted to enter the offices of the regional municipality. [size=no report]

On 27 May 2020, in Puente Alto (Metropolitana), nearly 150 citizens demonstrated over the lack of food and low income due to the coronavirus lockdown measures. The group built barricades to blocked the streets of the district to demand food assistance. Several attempts of looting and one person arrested were reported. [size=nearly 150]

On 27 May 2020, in Calama (Antofagasta), a group of citizens protested over the lack of water in their neighborhood. The group drove around several areas of the district to demand access to drink water. [size=no report]

On 27 May 2020, in San Bernardo (Metropolitana), at least 9 ambulance drivers protested against the long admission time patients have to wait to be admitted to the emergency room of a local hospital. The drivers turned on the car's sirens and claimed the ER is collapsed due to the high among of coronavirus cases. In some cases, patients in delicate conditions had to wait up to 5 hours to be hospitalized. [size=at least 9]

On 27 May 2020, in the rural area of Panguipulli (Los Rios), indigenous militiamen set on fire heavy machinery and other tools from private property. Pamphlets signed by the CAM demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found.

On 27 May 2020, in El Bosque (Metropolitana), nearly 60 citizens demonstrated over the lack of food and low income due to the coronavirus lockdown measures. The group demanded food assistance. Police forces of Chile used tear gas and water cannons to disperse people when barricades were built across the street. Rioters looted a local construction and stole material. [size=nearly 60]

On 27 May 2020, in San Miguel (Metropolitana), citizens demonstrated over the lack of food and low income due to the coronavirus lockdown measures. There were reports of violence but no particular episode was mentioned. The group demanded food assistance. [size=no report]

On 27 May 2020, near Pua (Araucania), a group of demonstrators built barricades and threw nails on Route 5. Several cars were damaged. [size=no report]

On 13 May 2020, in Ercilla (Araucania), suspected indigenous militia men attacked a police station in the municipality. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. No people were reported injured or killed.

On 13 April 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, workers of a company that cleans green areas in the city protested over the lack of payment of their salaries. The group reported that one of their colleagues was fired after demanding the payment of due wages. [size=no report]

source: El Sur; La Nacion (Chile); Biobio Chile
notes: On 13 April 2020, in the rural area of Tirua, Biobio region, members of the Mapuche Lavkenche Resistance (RMP) and police forces clashed. The RMP ambushed a police patrol and activated a car bomb to destroy a bridge that connects the municipalities of Tirua and Canete. Another explosion affected the energy service in the district of Tirua. The group is against the operation of logging companies in the area and repudiate Mapuche leaders who negotiate with such companies. No information on fatalities or injuries was reported/shared by the source.

On 12 April 2020, in Cerro Navia, Metropolitan region, a group of demonstrators clashed with members of Police Forces of Chile during a demonstration over general discontent with the Chilean government. The group gathered near a local hospital when the country's president was reported to take part in a ceremony in the facilities. Police arrested 7 people. [size=at least 7]

source: Mercurio Antofagasta; La Estrella Del Loa
notes: As reported on the weekend of 12 April 2020, in Antofagasta, Antofagasta region, demonstrators and police forces clashed when a group built and set on fire barricades in the main entrance of the city. Demonstrators demanded more measures to prevent the spread of the coronavirus in the district and the reinforcement of curfew measures in the break of the pandemic. Two people were reported injured, one of them ran over by a car. [size=no report]

On 12 April 2020, in the rural area of Lautaro, Araucania region, unidentified perpetrators set on fire heavy machinery that belonged to a logging company. Pamphlets demanding the release of arrested Mapuche individuals were found. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

As reported on 10 April 2020, in Santa Juana, Biobio region, a group of citizens protested over the lack of measures to prevent the spread of the coronavirus in the district. The group demands the reinforcement of curfew measures in the break of the pandemic. [size=no report]

On 10 April 2020, in Quidico (Biobio), an undetermined number of hooded men burnt down a summer cottage. The Araucania and Biobio regions constantly experience attacks from indigenous groups who demand land restitution from areas controlled by forestry companies.

On 9 April 2020, in the rural area of Huentelolen (Biobio), suspected indigenous militiamen attacked a police patrol that was guarding a logging property in the area. The men ambushed the bullet proof vehicle. One police officer was injured with at least 3 gunshots. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.
On 9 April 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, nurses protested over the lack of security equipment to treat patients with coronavirus in a local hospital. [size=no report]

On 8 April 2020, in Penalolen, Metropolitan region, a group of nearly 30 people attacked with rocks and other objects at a police station. Demonstrators built a set on fire barricades in the streets. Police use tear gas and water cannons to disperse the group. 27 people were arrested. The event happened during a political and social crisis in the country, with civil uprising continuing for several weeks. Another source reported the attack was carried by 100 demonstrators. [size=nearly 30]

On 8 April 2020, in Algarrobo, Valparaiso region, a group of citizens protested over the lack of sanitary controls to access the district. The group marched in the streets of the district demanding the reinforcement of curfew measures in the break of the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]
On 8 April 2020, in the rural area of Lautaro, Biobio region, unidentified men attacked a police patrol that attempted to move a barricade built across the road. No injures/casualties were reported.

On 7 April 2020, near Forrahue, Los Lagos region, residents protested against the traffic of large trucks in the area. The group reported that since controls for coronavirus were established in other routes, some companies opted to used local roads. The group blocked Route U-390 for several hours. [size=no report]

On 7 April 2020, in Punitaqui, Coquimbo region, a group of nearly 80 workers protested against the termination of a contract between a mining company and a contractor, which left nearly 180 people unemployed. The group also demanded the payment of owed salaries. Workers blocked the main entrance to the factory for several hours. The contractor had debts since October 2019; they claimed, however, that the coronavirus pandemic also affected their financial situation. [size=nearly 80]

On 7 April 2020, in Colchane, Tarapaca region, a group of nearly 500 Bolivian citizens clashed against the Military Forces of Bolivia, when the second ones blocked the access to the neighboring country. Demonstrators demanded the opening of the border, closed due to the coronavirus pandemic. One military soldier and a demonstrator were reported injured. [size=nearly 500]

As reported on 6 April 2020, in Tome, Biobio region, residents protested over the lack of security measures taken by the regional government to prevent the spread of coronavirus. The group demanded the disinfection of the buses and other vehicles that daily access the district. [size=no report]

On 6 April 2020, in Laraquete, Biobio region, a group of citizens blocked the streets to restrict the access of non-residents. The group demands the reinforcement of curfew measures in the break of the coronavirus pandemic. Police intervened and dispersed the group [size=no report]
On 6 April 2020, in Vina del Mar, Valparaiso region, health workers of a local hospital protested over the lack of security equipment to treat patients with coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 6 April 2020, in the rural area of Lota, Biobio region, a group of workers protested over the dismissal of employees of a local company. The group blocked the main entrance to the factory. Companies in the area have temporarily stopped their activities after a worker was tested positive for coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 5 April 2020, in Antofagasta, Antofagasta region, a group of rioters attacked with rocks an ambulance that attempted to pass a barricade built across the street. The motives for the group to built barricades were not reported by the source. [size=no report]

On 5 April 2020, in Cartagena, Valparaiso region, residents reported that a group of rioters attacked people that accused them of illegally occupying a plot in a residential area of the district. Two women were reported injured. [size=no report]

On 4 April 2020, in Puente Alto, Metropolitan region a group of prisoners demonstrated inside the local jail. The inmates set on fire several objects and clashed with the guards. The inmates demand more security to prevent the spread of coronavirus inside the prison. This happened after 5 reported cases of coronavirus in prisoners. [size=no report]

On 4 April 2020, in Los Angeles, Biobio region, members of the military forces of Chile opened fire when a civilian attempted to avoid a military checkpoint set to control a national lockdown implemented due to the coronavirus pandemic. No information on fatalities or injuries was reported/shared by the source.

As reported on 1 April 2020, in Independencia, Metropolitan region, bus drivers and workers of a bus company protested over the dismissal of nearly 350 workers due to the coronavirus pandemic. The group blocked the entrance to the main building of the bus company and demanded work security for workers in the country. [size=no report]

In the week of 1 April 2020, in San Bernardo, Metropolitan region, police forces of Chile and rioters clashed during an attempt to loot a local supermarket in the area. The event was reported during a curfew stated by local authorities to slow the spread of coronavirus in the metropolitan area. Sources reported that some of the rioters used guns against police officers. No information on fatalities or injuries was reported/shared by the source. [size=no report]

On 1 April 2020, in the rural area of Mulchen, Biobio region, a group of residents protested against the traffic of large trucks in the area. The group claimed the permanent movement of these vehicles disrupts their sleep at night. The group blocked the road for several hours to demand regulations. [size=no report]

On 31 March 2020, in Linares, Maule region, members of the military forces of Chile opened fire when a civilian attempted to avoid a military checkpoint set to control a national lockdown for coronavirus pandemic. No person was injured in the event.

As reported on 31 March 2020, in Talcahuano, Biobio region, a group of 6 citizens demonstrated against the government in the commemoration of the day of the young combatant. The built and set on fire a barricade across the road. Police arrested 3 people. [size=6]

On 31 March 2020, in Pucon, Araucania region, unidentified men set on fire a helicopter. The aircraft was completely destroyed. There have been several attacks in the Araucania region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

On 31 March 2020, in San Antonio, Valparaiso region, workers of a local hospital protested against the reduction of their salaries. The group staged a protest in front of the hospital facilities. The hospital administration claimed the payment is deferred due to the economic impact of the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 30 March 2020, in Nueva Imperial, Araucania region, a group of 28 prisoners protested over the lack of security measures taken by the jail administration to prevent the spread of coronavirus among the prisoners. The group also announced the beginning of a hunger strike. [size=28]

As reported on 30 March 2020, in Talagante, Metropolitan region, bus drivers protested over the lack of security measures taken by the company to prevent spread of coronavirus among the drivers. The group stopped all transport activities, and demanded the disinfection of the buses, affecting at least 5 district of the Metropolitan area. [size=no report]

On 30 March 2020, in Antofagasta, Antofagasta region, bus drivers protested over the lack of security measures taken by the company to prevent the spread of coronavirus among the drivers. The group staged a demonstration in the city and called for the support of the national government to cover the reduction of income among bus drivers. [size=no report]

On 30 March 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitan region, a group of workers of the Metro system protested over the lack of security measures taken by the company to prevent the spread of coronavirus among the employees. The group protested inside a metro station in Santiago-La Moneda. [size=no report]

On 30 March 2020, in Valdivia, Los Rios region, a group of 27 prisoners protested over the delays in their legal processes. The group demands expedited jury trials considering the high risk of coronavirus contagion in local jails. The group also announced the beginning of a hunger strike. [size=27]

On 29 March 2020, in San Bernardo, Metropolitan region, a group of citizens demonstrated against the government in the commemoration of the day of the young combatant. The group set on fire barricades and attacked the police station, reportedly with weapons. [size=no report]

On 29 March 2020, in Arica, Arica y Parinacota region, members of the military forces of Chile opened fire against a private car when the driver attempted to avoid a military checkpoint set to control a national lockdown for coronavirus pandemic. The victim is severely injured in the ICU of the local hospital.

On 29 March 2020, in Penalolen, Metropolitan region, a group of citizens demonstrated against the government in the commemoration of the day of the young combatant. The were reports of violence by demonstrators, but not specific episode was mentioned [size=no report]

On 29 March 2020, in Huechuraba, Metropolitan region, a group of citizens demonstrated against the government in the commemoration of the day of the young combatant. The group clashed with police forces when some demonstrators vandalized the police stations. Barricades were built and set on fire across the streets. [size=no report]

On 29 March 2020, in Melipilla, Metropolitan region, a group of citizens demonstrated against the government in the commemoration of the day of the young combatant. The group built and set on fire across the freeway. [size=no report]

notes: On 29 March 2020, in Estacion Central, Metropolitan region, a group of citizens demonstrated against the government in the commemoration of the day of the young combatant. On 29 March 2020, in Puente Alto, Metropolitan region a group of prisoners started a riot inside the local jail. The inmates set on fire several objects. The group clashed with guards that used tear gas. The reason behind the riot was a suspected case of coronavirus in one of the prisoners. Meanwhile, outside the facilities some families of prisoners also clashed against security forces. 26 people were reported injured. [size=at least 26]

On 27 March 2020, in the rural area of Tirua, Biobio region, a group of nearly 20 unidentified armed men set on fire a cargo truck. The men blocked the road and forced the driver out. The vehicle was destroyed, while the driver suffered minor injuries during the attack. There have been several attacks in Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights.

On 27 March 2020, in Valparaiso, Valparaiso region, more than 100 taxi drivers protested against the government. The group considers the economic measures taken by the government to mitigate the economic crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic are insufficient and demanded for more protection for independent workers. On 27 March 2020, in the rural area of Quidico (Biobio), a trucks of a logging company was set on fire by a group of four armed men. There have been several attacks in the Biobio region perpetrated by indigenous groups who demand land rights. The driver was injured in the event.

On 6 March 2020, in Santiago, Metropolitan region, students demonstrated over general discontent with the government. The group's demands included reforms in education, healthcare, and pension policies, among other things. Students and Police forces clashed, with the first ones using Molotov bombs against state forces. Police used tear gas to dispersed the group. On 19 October 2019, in Tocopilla, Atacama region, a group of 20 rioters attacked a police guard near the police station of the municipality. One person was reported arrested. This happened after a group of citizens demonstrated against the state of emergency and the militarization of Santiago. The group blocked the road for several hours. Police forces of Chile dispersed demonstrators with tear gas. [size=20]

[size=around 100]

On 22 April 2019, in the rural area of Victoria, Araucania region, around 60 members of the Mapuche community occupied a plot of land, claiming it belonged to the indigenous community. According to reports, police forces used excessive force against civilians, resulting in the hospitalization of several children and women.
